FortSetting.GamepadAutoRun_Description: Turns controller auto-run on/off. When on, double clicking the Left Stick will make you automatically run forward without needing to hold the Left Stick forward.
FortSetting.TextChat_Desc:
Choose who your child can send and receive messages with in groups, parties, and games. Your child can only send and receive one-on-one messages with Epic friends.

<text color="00FFD6FF" fontface="black" case="upper" size="20">Everybody</>: Your child can text chat with everyone.

<text color="00FFD6FF" fontface="black" case="upper" size="20">Friends, team members, and connections</>: Your child can text chat with Epic friends, platform friends, everyone on their team, and connections. Connections are people who your child isn't friends with but who are connected to your child through their friends. Team sizes vary by experience and can range from a few players to everyone in a game.

<text color="00FFD6FF" fontface="black" case="upper" size="20">Friends Only</>: Your child can text chat only with their Epic and platform friends.

<text color="00FFD6FF" fontface="black" case="upper" size="20">Nobody</>: Your child can't text chat with anyone.

Selecting <strong>Nobody</> still allows players to use messages from a list of in-game safe phrases (like "Nice one!\
FortSetting.VoiceChat_ParentalControls_Description_E:
Choose who your child can speak with in groups, parties, and games.

<text color="00FFD6FF" fontface="black" case="upper" size="20">Everybody</> : Your child can voice chat with everyone.

<text color="00FFD6FF" fontface="black" case="upper" size="20">Friends, team members, and connections</> : Your child can voice chat with Epic friends, platform friends, everyone on their team, and connections. Connections are people who your child isn't friends with but who are connected to your child through their friends. Team sizes vary by experience and can range from a few players to everyone in a game.

<text color="00FFD6FF" fontface="black" case="upper" size="20">Friends only</> : Your child can voice chat only with their Epic and platform friends.

<text color="00FFD6FF" fontface="black" case="upper" size="20">Nobody</> : Your child can't voice chat with anyone.
FortSetting.VoiceChat_ExpandedSettings_Description:
Sets who you can speak with in groups, parties, and games.

<strong>Everybody</>: You can voice chat with everyone.

<strong>Friends, team members, and connections</>: You can voice chat with: Epic friends, platform friends (like Xbox), connections, and everyone on your team. Connections are people who aren’t your direct friends but are linked to you through your friends. Team sizes vary by experience and can range from a few players to everyone in a game.

<strong>Friends Only</>: You can voice chat only with your Epic and platform friends.

<strong>Off</>: You can't voice chat with anyone.

<strong>About voice reporting</>
Voice reporting stores chat audio on each participant’s device on a rolling five-minute basis. This audio will be sent to Epic Games if someone reports a violation. Voice reporting is usually on, except if all in a chat has reporting off. You can check if voice reporting is on or off in the sidebar. Voice reporting is always on for under 18s.
FortSetting.VoiceChat_ExpandedSettingsWithDeprecated:
Sets who you can speak with in groups, parties, and games.

<strong>Everybody</>: You can voice chat with everyone.

<strong>Friends, team members, and connections</>: You can voice chat with: Epic friends, platform friends (like Xbox), connections, and everyone on your team. Connections are people who aren’t your direct friends but are linked to you through your friends. Team sizes vary by experience and can range from a few players to everyone in a game.

<strong>Friends and Teammates</>: You can voice chat with your Epic and platform friends and with others who are not your friends in parties and teams. Team sizes vary by experience, from a few players to all in a game.

<strong>Friends Only</>: You can voice chat only with your Epic and platform friends.

<strong>Off</>: You can't voice chat with anyone.

<strong>About voice reporting</>
Voice reporting stores chat audio on each participant’s device on a rolling five-minute basis. This audio will be sent to Epic Games if someone reports a violation. Voice reporting is usually on, except if all in a chat has reporting off. You can check if voice reporting is on or off in the sidebar. Voice reporting is always on for under 18s.
FortSetting.TextChat_ExpandedSettings_Description:
Sets who you can text chat with in groups, parties, and games. You can only send and receive one-on-one messages with your friends.

<strong>Everybody</>: You can text chat with everyone. 

<strong>Friends, team members, and connections</>: You can text chat with: Epic friends, platform friends (like Xbox), connections, and everyone on your team. Connections are people who aren’t your direct friends but are linked to you through your friends. Team sizes vary by experience and can range from a few players to everyone in a game.

<strong>Friends Only</>: You can text chat only with your Epic and platform friends. 

<strong>Off</>: You can't text chat with anyone.

<strong>About Text Reporting</>
Text reporting enables the contents of your text chats to be sent to Epic Games when someone reports a violation.
Text reporting is usually on, except if everyone in a chat has it turned off. You can check if text reporting is on or off in the message box.
Text reporting is always on for under 18s and in all game chats. In those chats, our systems will automatically detect and report threats of real-world violence, child endangerment, and self-harm to Epic for review.
FortSetting.TextChat_ExpandedSettingsWithDeprecated_:
Sets who you can text chat with in groups, parties, and games. You can only send and receive one-on-one messages with your friends.

Your permission is set to <strong>Friends and teammates</>, so you can’t see messages from anyone else. Your parent can change this setting to include connections — people not on your friends list, like group members.

<strong>Everybody</>: You can text chat with everyone. 

<strong>Friends, team members, and connections</>: You can text chat with: Epic friends, platform friends (like Xbox), connections, and everyone on your team. Connections are people who aren’t your direct friends but are linked to you through your friends. Team sizes vary by experience and can range from a few players to everyone in a game.

<strong>Friends and teammates</>: You can text chat with your Epic and platform friends and with others who are not your friends in parties and teams. Team sizes vary by experience, from a few players to all in a game.

<strong>Friends Only</>: You can text chat only with your Epic and platform friends. 

<strong>Off</>: You can't text chat with anyone.

<strong>About Text Reporting</>
Text reporting enables the contents of your text chats to be sent to Epic Games when someone reports a violation.
Text reporting is usually on, except if everyone in a chat has it turned off. You can check if text reporting is on or off in the message box.
Text reporting is always on for under 18s and in all game chats. In those chats, our systems will automatically detect and report threats of real-world violence, child endangerment, and self-harm to Epic for review.
